title: Englewood boy, 7, dies from self-inflicted gunshot wound
content:
You need to have the Adobe Flash Player to view this content. Please click here to continue.
CHICAGO -- A 7-year-old boy has died after he suffered a self-inflicted gunshot wound Sunday in the city's Englewood neighborhood.
The Chicago Fire Department confirmed they transported the boy from the 6700 block of South Aberdeen Street Sunday afternoon after he suffered a gunshot wound.
He was transported to Comer Children's Hospital. According to police, he was pronounced dead.
The incident happened around 3:30 p.m.
Family members told WGN the boy was home with his younger brother and they were playing around with the gun thinking it was a toy.
The victim's brother ran over to a neighbor's house to call police. The boy lived in the house with his brother, mother and grandmother.
